title: Should we file separate tax returns we are not legally separated
question: My husband and I are separated should we file separate tax returns We are 68 years old I am living in the house now and I would like to see the house go to our children
answers:
It most cases it is better to file joint returns. See my legal guide for eligibility fo filing jointly at https://www.avvo.com/legal-guides/ugc/joint-return. Sometimes married filing separately results in lower taxes but not usually; you need to crunch the numbers both ways to see which results in lesser taxes. Additionally, if your husband may owe a lot of taxes during a tax year, then married filing separately would protect against joint and several liability for his tax debts.
As for the house, you need to speak with a CA estates lawyer to ensure the right result, especially in light of their community property rules.
